page.title: 16RECREATION AND EVENTS 2
page.content: IN MOOR MONKTON ON FERRY INGS THERE IS A CARAVAN SITE FOR ABOUT 20 CARAVANS BORDERING THE NIDD. BOATS MOOR ON THIS REACH. MANY LOCAL PEOPLE KEEP HORSES. RIDING AND HUNTING ARE POPULAR. SPORTS DAYS, CHRISTMAS PARTIES AND OTHER FESTIVAL EVENTS DRAW CHILDREN FROM THE WHOLE PARISH. THE CHURCHES CELEBRATE THE MAIN CHRISTIAN FESTIVALS, THE MOST POPULAR BEING THE HARVEST FESTIVAL.THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE IS USED AS A VILLAGE HALL SINCE ITS CLOSURE IN 1950. SOCIAL EVENTS TAKE PLACE THERE AND A BRANCH OF THE YORKSHIRE COUNTRYWOMEN'S ASSOCIATION HOLDS ITS MEETINGS THERE. MOST OF THE VILLAGERS ARE KEEN GARDENERS WHO TAKE GREAT PRIDE IN THEIR ENVIRONMENT, KEEPING THEIR SURROUNDINGS LITTER-FREE AND TIDY.
